incidents.name: Intermittent timeouts with the "Ask AIC" function within AI Companion

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We have resolved an intermittent issue with “Ask AIC” features that require a lookup to the internet failing and an additional issue regarding the AIC enabled meetings where the "Catch me up" function was returning an error. A fix has been implemented and we will continue to monitor and provide updates as we have them.
We are continuing to work on resolving the issues reported in this incident. More updates will be provided as soon as we have them.

We continue to identify and investigate the intermittent issue with “Ask AIC” features that require a lookup to the internet failing. We will continue to provide updates as we have them. We are now experiencing an additional issue regarding the AIC enabled meetings and investigating it as well, where the "Catch me up" function in AIC is returning error - “Apologize for the inconvenience, but it seems that the service has timed out”.
Zoom has identified an intermittent issue with “Ask AIC” features that require a lookup to the internet failing. We are working on addressing this issue and will post updates as we have them.
We are investigating intermittent timeouts with the "Ask AIC" part of AI Companion affecting US meetings only. More updates will be provided as soon as we have them.

We have identified the issue and have taken action which restored some affected AIC services, and we continue working to restore all affected AIC services.  We will continue to provide updates as we have them.
We are investigating an issue affecting Zoom AI Companion for a subset of customers in EU.  We will provide updates as we have them.

incidents.name: Issue with multiple Zoom Services

incident_updates.body:
Zoom is aware of the critical nature of our services, and it is our responsibility to provide the highest availability. We sincerely apologize for the incident and the impact on our customers. We take this very seriously, and our goal is to do everything possible to make sure this type of incident cannot happen again.

Included is the summary, root cause, solution, and the prevention plan.

Service Issue:
Reported: April 16, 2025 11:25 AM PDT
Resolved: April 16, 2025 1:12 PM PDT

Summary:
Customers could not access Zoom services in the US and International regions due to the unavailability of the zoom.us domain.

Root Cause:
On April 16, 2025, Zoom started to investigate the zoom.us domain resolution failures. Upon investigation, Zoom's domain name servers were properly replying to requests. However, upon further investigation with our registrar Markmonitor and GoDaddy Registry, the domain zoom.us was unavailable due to a server block by GoDaddy Registry. This block was the result of a communication error between Zoom’s domain registrar, Markmonitor, and GoDaddy Registry, which resulted in GoDaddy Registry mistakenly shutting down the zoom.us domain. There was no product, security, network failure, or Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack at Zoom during the outage.

End users who had already joined Zoom meetings or Zoom phone calls were not impacted. Any start, join, or schedule meetings actions were unable to be completed successfully since the requests required a DNS lookup, which could not be completed.

Solution:
Zoom, Markmonitor, and GoDaddy worked to identify and remove the server block, which restored service to the zoom.us domain. Due to the DNS entries themselves being cached at multiple levels and having a time-to-live (TTL) set, it took a few additional minutes to propagate across all Internet infrastructure after the zoom.us domain reactivation.

Prevention:
Zoom worked with GoDaddy Registry and Markmonitor to implement additional technical changes and processes to help ensure that this issue does not reoccur. As a part of that change, GoDaddy Registry and Markmonitor have already put in place a registry lock that restricts server block commands from being placed on the zoom.us domain.

affected_components.name: Zoom Phone - Global - Web Portal (Admin/Users/Provisioning/Dashboard & Reporting)
Zoom Contact Center - Global - Web Portal (Admin/Users/Provisioning)

incident_updates.body:
All Zoom services have been restored, if you are still having connection issues please flush your DNS cache and reconnect.

For Windows open a command prompt and type "ipconfig /flushdns"
For Mac open a terminal window and type "sudo dscacheutil -flushcache; sudo killall -HUP mDNSResponder"

affected_components.name: Zoom Phone - Global - Web Portal (Admin/Users/Provisioning/Dashboard & Reporting)
Zoom Contact Center - Global - Web Portal (Admin/Users/Provisioning)

incident_updates.body:
Services have been restored, if you are still having connection issues please flush your DNS cache and attempt to reconnect.

For Windows open a command prompt and type "ipconfig /flushdns"
For Mac open a terminal window and type "sudo dscacheutil -flushcache; sudo killall -HUP mDNSResponder"

incidents.name: A subset of users experiencing connectivity issues with international dial in numbers from Japan.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We have fixed the issue where a subset of users were experiencing connectivity issues with international dial in numbers from Japan. We will continue to monitor & provide updates as soon as there is more information to share.

Update : 

Our team has informed that users can further connect to the dial in service via these toll free numbers in Japan 
0 120 829 768
0 120 836 177 
00 663 381 4092

Meanwhile, our team is working with our vendor to investigate the root cause. Zoom will provide updates as soon as there is more information to share.

We have detected service degradation where subset of users would be experiencing connectivity issues with international dial in numbers from Japan
Kindly note, you may still connect to the dial in service via +81 363 628 317. 

Our engineers are currently investigating the impact and root cause. Zoom will provide updates as soon as there is more information to share.

incidents.name: Issue with Enable Nested app authentication for Outlook Add-in SSO

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Enable Nested app authentication for “Outlook Add-in SSO" authentication flow is not functioning as expected.  The team has identified the problem and is scheduled to deploying the fix this evening, January 17.  
 
The launch of this feature is underway and customer communications inviting admins to enable it have been sent. However the implementation of the feature is not performing as expected and requires a deployment to remediate.
 
There is no impact to end users as this is an administrative function only.

incidents.name: Issue with Zoom Phone inbound calls for Mexico and Panama numbers

incident_updates.body: On 1/17/2025 from 18:26 UTC to 21:48 UTC, a subset of users may experienced inbound call issues with Mexico and Panama numbers on Zoom Phone.  We have fixed this issue and the incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Issues with Zoom services in São Paulo

incident_updates.body: On 1/17/2025 from 17:40 UTC to 17:47 UTC, users will have experienced issues in São Paulo region.  We have fixed this issue and the incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Users in India & Canada may have experienced issues accessing AIC services

incident_updates.body: On 1/9/2025 from 6:25 UTC to 7:59 UTC, users in India & Canada may have experienced issues accessing AIC services. We have fixed this issue and the incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Zoom Phone maintenance rollback

incident_updates.body:
From 01:00 12/21 UTC - 01:00 12/22 UTC, Zoom has successfully completed the Zoom Phone maintenance to route additional Zoom Phone & Zoom Contact Center traffic across our new Data Centers (https://status.zoom.us/incidents/1xtdkft6972m).  Due to internal monitoring detection and a few customers’ feedback, there are possible misconfigurations in some customers’ firewall side, Zoom has decided to rollback these changes and work directly with customers to confirm all services are working correctly for them.

In order for customers to avoid any potential issues in the future, please allow Zoom Traffic to all subnets located on our Zoom Network Firewall page including signaling and media (https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0060548)
